section.p: For days you slog on, hungry and half-blind with the glare of low, slanting rays of sunlight that glance off the ice. You are bone weary but it is too cold to snatch more than a few minutes’ sleep. Each footstep plunges you thigh-deep in snow. Avalanches are a constant threat. You should never have ventured into this merciless wasteland.
Lose 1-6 Stamina points (the roll of one die) and, if still alive, .
